category: Member city/provincial sports association regulations/Article 27 (Appointment of officers)
contents: Article 27 (Appointment of Executives) ① The vice president and directors (excluding the secretary general) are appointed at the general meeting from among those recommended by the president. However, the appointment authority may be delegated to the chairman by resolution of the general meeting, and in this case, the appointment results must be reported at the next general meeting. Revised on March 23, 2017. ② The deadline for the authority to appoint officers delegated pursuant to the proviso to Paragraph 1 shall be effective until immediately before the first board of directors meeting after the delegation, except in cases specifically determined by the general meeting. Newly established on November 21, 2017, July 29, 2020. ③ City/provincial sports councils must include one school sports expert as vice president. ④ Executives must be composed evenly, including personnel representing school sports, professional sports, and recreational sports, and unless there is a justifiable reason, the following requirements must be met. Amendment 2017. 3. 23., 2017. 5. 15., 2021. 10. 6., 2022. 5. 10. [Previous paragraph 4 deleted 2017. 3. 23.] 1. Deleted 2021. 10. 6. 2. Professional sports officials must account for at least 20% of the registered executives. 3. Lifestyle sports officials (excluding former athletes) must account for at least 20% of the registered executives. 4. Education figures and city/county/district sports council executives must account for at least 20% of the registered executives. 5. Non-competitive people (academic, media, legal, etc.) must account for more than 20% of the registered executives. Revised July 24, 2019. 6. Efforts should be made to ensure that the ratio of specific genders does not exceed 70%. Revised on February 4, 7, 2021. Graduates and current employees of the same university cannot exceed 40% of the registered officers. [Moved from Paragraph 1] ⑤ Deleted July 29, 2020 ⑥ Auditors shall be appointed at the general meeting. , for administrative audit, one person from a city/provincial sports organization and one person from a city/county/district sports association are appointed from among the regular member organization representatives, and for accounting audit, one person with a certified public accountant qualification is appointed. Revised May 29, 2019, October 6, 2021 ⑦ When there is a vacancy in the position of vice president and director, the person recommended by the chairman shall be elected by the board of directors, and this shall be reported to the next general meeting. ⑧ The president takes office with the approval of the Sports Council, and if an officer's disqualification or other reasons are revealed after approval and there is a defect in the approval, the Sports Council may cancel or withdraw approval ex officio. Revised 2017. 5. 15., 2019. 12. 20., 2020. 3. 30., 2020. 7. 29., 2021. 10. 6., 2022. 5. 10. ⑨ The sports association does not have the required documents. If not, it cannot be approved. Revised 2021. 2. 4. ⑩ If a person with the qualifications of a representative pursuant to Article 11, Paragraph 1 becomes an executive of a city/provincial sports association, the number of directors shall exceed 20% of the fixed number of directors (including the chairman and vice-chairman) determined pursuant to Article 23. Can not. In this case, only one person from one organization can be appointed as an executive. Revised 2016. 4. 29., 2017. 3. 23., 2017. 5. 15., 2021. 2. 4. [Title revised 2021. 10. 6.] ⑪ City/provincial sports councils report the results of selection of executives to the sports council. It must be registered and managed in the sports information system. Newly established 2023. 7. 5.
